intro: Vicia tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in early summer. Vicia tricuspidata is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
